content.prompt: A random sample of n people selected from a large population will be asked whether they have read a novel in the past year. Let the random variable R represent the number of people from the sample who answer yes. The variance of random variable R is 6. Assume the responses are independent of each other. If the proportion of people from the population who read a novel in the past year is 0.40, which of the following is the best interpretation of random variable R ?

choices.label: A binomial variable with 15 independent trials
A binomial variable with 25 independent trials
A variable that is not binomial with 25 independent trials
A binomial variable with 40 independent trials
A variable that is not binomial with 40 independent trials

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
